intro: Anthospermum aethiopicum var. oppositifolium, commonly known as the opposite-leaf anthospermum, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its opposite leaf arrangement, where leaves are paired along the stem. The plant typically features small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in clusters. Its foliage is often used in traditional medicine for its purported therapeutic properties. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and Asia.
